page.title: 05Interview- a local resident
page.content: Emma and I interviewed Mrs Huntriss to see how the village has changed in the thirty years she has been here. The traffic has built enormousley not only in quantity but in size.It cuts the village in half and it is very dangerous.More than half the people you meet are strangers now.The population is 3000 and still growing.In the past the neighbours knew when people were ill or needed help.The village museum is an attempt to reflect the life of the village's past.A few rows of cottages have disappeared along Hawk Lane and the Bowling Green.The shops in the High Street used to be derelict gardens.
